website_summaries.verdict: Provides a nice performance level when used in high temperature situations where cheaper fluids break down.
pros: Recommended for safe use by several different automobile manufacturers
Fluid that contains less sulfur than other options
Should give your manual transmission system the ability to make shifts just a little quicker with smoother movement in the system
cons: A little expensive versus some other fluids
A little messy to pour with odd bottle design

customer_reviews.title: Good oil... small bottle issue
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, the oil seems high quality and I can tell my tranny is shifting smoother. However, yes the bottle too is too small for the standard hand pump? So make the bottle be lcl bigger or make a pump that fits? When the pump slides into the bottle it's so tite as you pump it, the bottle collapses. I poked a small hole in the top of the bottle to eliminate that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: This lubricant is amazing and I am now a believer
customer_reviews.text: I had just changed my six speed manual transmission oil in my 2000 Mazda Miata SE with a "major brand synthetic product" but was unhappy with the way it shifted. After reading many reviews and recommendation for this product, I decided to dump the oil and change to this product. Many reviews commented on the difference in this GL 4 oil vs GL 5 and how the shifting became "buttery smooth." I was somewhat skeptical and didn't really believe the description. Well, needless to say....I couldn't believe the difference! This lubricant is amazing and I am now a believer! This will be the only transmission lubricant I will use in my Miata! Very Happy...Thank you Red Line!
customer_reviews.author: HotRod

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: You just can’t beat this stuff. In old BMWs and my 85 RX-7, the transformation is stunning. Makes it feel like I rebuilt the transmission. The RX was notchy and it was a little harder to shift into first than I liked. I wasn’t sure if it was just how the transmission was designed. I drained the old oil out- it looked pretty fresh, so I wasn’t optimistic that the redline would make any difference. Boy was I wrong. Slips straight into first like a brand new car.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Fala

customer_reviews.title: Car is shifting buttery smooth now!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my manual transmission oil with this redline synthetic in my rx8 around 30,000 miles and was very please with the results. I thought the car shifted well before but now it's buttery smooth. Doesn't seem like I have to wait for the oil to warm up to get nice smooth shifts. It's good to go right off the bat. Simple job just remove fill plug on the transmission then remove drain plug. Clean and replace drain plug when the oil is all out and pump in the Redline. I usedto pump in the oil and stopped when it started to trickle out of the fill plug.
customer_reviews.author: Renesis Powered

customer_reviews.title: Seems good to me....
customer_reviews.text: I can't really say this fluid is "amazing" as going from old fluid to new fluid always feels better. The fluid that came out of my car was black and it was oem Toyota fluid with 60K on it. This new fluid smells nice, looks good, and works great. But going from that old tired fluid to new fluid was going to feel better regardless. I have a lot of respect for Redline and I recommend it, just don't expect a big difference. Old fluid feels sludgy, new fluid always feel cleaner regardless who makes it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Tate

customer_reviews.title: Does your trans require GL-4?  Here's your solution
customer_reviews.text: So every single auto parts chain near me only has GL-5 fluid for manual transmissions. THIS IS NOT GOOD FOR TRANSMISSIONS that need GL-4 fluid. GL-5 has additives like sulfur that corrode and eat away "yellow" metals. Many differentials can tolerate GL-5 fluid in place of GL-4, but not manual transmissions. This stuff is expensive but it is GL-4 and won't eat away those synchronizers. I think $40 for a trans fluid change is a small price to pay to protect your investment of thousands.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Osborne

customer_reviews.title: The Best For A First Generation Toyota Tacoma
customer_reviews.text: I had filled my 1996 5 speed with Texaco GL-5 spec synthetic gear oil. My transmission became notchy and at 200k+ miles I thought it was just giving out. I read good reviews of the Redline gear oil. I dumped the Texaco and filled with the Red Line. Amazing difference. My transmission shifts like butter. Never would have expected it. Older Tacomas really need the GL-4 spec.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Synthetic fluid = smooth shifting manual trans
customer_reviews.text: Ordered to be used in my getrag g360 manual trans behind my cummins diesel. I mix MTL and MT90 4:1 and based on noise reduction and smooth shifting my trans loves it. It’s a synthetic fluid so it should last a long long time until it needs changing. However, I will likely change it every 30-50k miles (Depending on severity of use) since oil is far cheaper than rebuilds.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Give It Time, Great for GL4 transmissions
customer_reviews.text: Give it time, this gear oil is the real deal, especially if your trans calls for GL4. I rebuilt my manual trans on my 91 Nissan 240sx and made the mistake of using the Lucas “universal” Gl5/GL4 gear oil after the rebuild. I noticed the trans was still noisy and had issues shifting into 1st gear. I drained that oil after 50 miles and put in the RL MT-90. At first no noticeable difference, but after a few hundred miles I notice the trans shifts nicely into 1st now and through all the gears. It’s much quieter now too.
customer_reviews.author: Spikey Racer

customer_reviews.title: Very good manual transmission oil but package leaks.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this oil before on my '05 Jeep Wrangler to smooth out the manual transmission. It works very well but I figured it was time to change it since it has been in the Jeep for well over 100k miles. Only problem was that Amazon ships it without any leak protection, it was just sitting loose in the box with other items. Naturally, it leaked some. Not a lot and it didn't affect the other items that were shipped with it but I wouldn't want it shipped with anything that oil could damage. Most other companies put liquid items into a bag to help contain any leakage that might occur. Might want to order separate from other items.
customer_reviews.author: Db

customer_reviews.title: Love it, won't use anything else in my MT cars.
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. I've put it in every MT car I've owned for the last 10 years. Makes for such smooth shifts, even in old worn transmissions. Give it some time, it will get the syncros back in order. At least it has in the Toyota/Nissan/Mazda applications I have used it in. My 04 6wagon loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Anton

customer_reviews.title: If your transmission is a synchronizer type and those are ...
customer_reviews.text: If your transmission is a synchronizer type and those are brass or bronze, this is the fluid for you. GL-4's are brass friendly. As it reads on the bottle, its "less slippery" than many other oils of the same weight, which is a very important factor to consider when cone synchronizers rely on a bit of friction to match spindle speeds and allow dog teeth engagement. It may fix your problem or at least band-aid an older synchronizer and greatly extend the life of the transmission.
customer_reviews.author: FrootLoop

customer_reviews.title: Just what my transmission needed
customer_reviews.text: Was using royal purple for my 05 scion xb manual transmission for awhile. Shifting was pretty normal beside first gear being slightly rougher. Wow what a difference this oil made in my cars transmission. Gears are much smoother, I dont get the occasional crunch in first gear. I will definitely be buy more of this gear oil when it comes time to replace oils.
customer_reviews.author: luis guzman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for AX-15 trans
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect gear oil for my 1998 Dodge Dakota, with the AX-15, 5 speed manual transmission. I don't know what kind/brand of oil was in the trans, as I just recently bought this truck. But what I do know, is that it wasn't shifting as smooth as I felt it should. I went and researched on all the Dodge and Jeep forums. some Jeeps have the same AX-15 trans, and this oil was clearly the highest recommended one. And they were right, because after changing my oil to the MT-90 my truck shifts silky smooth now. Red Line has always been know for great products, and this is definitely another great one. Worked perfectly in my truck.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Straughn

customer_reviews.title: Great product but not a miracle cure
customer_reviews.text: I change my transmission fluid to this in my 1992 Geo Metro with a manual transmission and could not tell a very big difference. I had had red mini reviews about how this is God's gift to Transmissions but for me it's the same as the other oils... Granted I did not have trouble shifting before and have driven 2000 miles since changing the lubricant. I'm a big fan of synthetics regardless if you can tell the difference I think it protects the gears and metal much better.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Doing well on my 2008 Scion XD
customer_reviews.text: I hate it when the Toyota dealer just sells you stuff that has a sticker on it that mainly tells you "Genuine Toyota" with no corresponding specs + at a higher price. This product's spec meets the spec on what the Toyota Manual states specifically. My Scion XD is a closed system so I replaced it myself after watching YouTube videos. (@ 126K+ / manual transmission with no problems even at that mileage). I'm confident enough that this will give me another 100K+...
customer_reviews.author: Michael E.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 1st Gen Scion xB
customer_reviews.text: Used royal purple 75w-90 before Redline and it made the feel very notchy to the point it would grind (slightly) into gear. Drained the royal purple (Which was basically water), Put in MT-90 and it drives smooth with no more grinding or notchy feel. If you have a 04-06 Scion xB, get this for your manual trans! Skip royal purple all together.
customer_reviews.author: MACHAMP

customer_reviews.title: made shifting smoother
customer_reviews.text: well, not much to say as i feel it smoother on shifting. only downside is the bottle opening. can't really find a right pump for it. i end up just cutting it down to the first top and was able to use a pump that i had. it didn't screw on so i just had to be extra careful not to tip it over. used it in a 2007 carolla s manual transmission that had about 132k miles on it. looks like previous owner never changed it.
customer_reviews.author: Lon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is like magic. I have used it in multiple transmissions, and it has (so far) delayed replacement/rebuild for years. On my 350Z and Smart 451 it improved shifting smoothness and drive ability, It obviously cannot change wear but is more "sticky" than other lubricants and noticeably improves shifting. I will never use another product for manual transmission lubrication.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Stettler

customer_reviews.title: Great for Miatas
customer_reviews.text: Amazing results when used in my 97 M-Edition Mazda MX-5 Miata. I have a 5-Speed transmission and shifts were a bit clunky before. I changed the fluid with this stuff and it shifts as smooth as silk. I don't know how much that had to do with the fluid having never been changed before I did it. haha. Also be sure to check your turret fluid level where the shifter is in your car. Mine was pretty dry in there at only 75,000 miles. Next I need to get a shifter rebuild kit. You are going to need two bottles for the first gen. Miata...
customer_reviews.author: Shane Gumm

customer_reviews.title: A+++ Scion owners you gota try this stuff it rocks
customer_reviews.text: 2005 scion xb (XBox) **UPDATE** Been running this stuff for 3 days and so far i couldnt be happier, my scion was fun to drive before but now i love it, i dont know what this stuff is made of but it has unleashed my transmission, shifting is a breeze and the friggin power i have now gettin the rpms up is amazing.If you got a scion 5 speed u gota try this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: christopher steelman

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Expensive when compared to other other brands of gear oil but this product really works. It smooths out shifting in manual transmissions considerably. It also lasts a long time. Replaced it after a couple of years of hard offroad use and it still looked just as clear as it did when I put it in. Great performance, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: 21days

customer_reviews.title: Works great. easier shifting, worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Redline is worth the extra cost. I replaced my 5 speed trans fluid with Redline to see if it would help smooth out gear shifting on my 185,000 mile, original transmission, Mazda RX7. The result for me: I immediately noticed smoother, less effort shifting, and a quieter transmission. It really works.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Transmission help
customer_reviews.text: Changed out old oil from Transmission (5 speed Toyota Truck) and it helped so much more than I can believe. What I took out of the transmission was obviously bad but this stuff made it shift better than new and it had 350 K miles on it.
customer_reviews.author: Keith M. Banker Jr.

customer_reviews.title: 2006 Scion XB manual trans fluid
customer_reviews.text: Best GL-4 trans fluid ever. My 2006 Scion XB was feeling notchy. Replaced fluid with valvoline synthetic 75-90w. It was worse. After reviews I went with MT-90. Smooth as butter shifts now. Very happy. Thanks??
customer_reviews.author: Ruthless671

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for AX15
customer_reviews.text: Used to replace the transmission lubricant in an AX15 manual transmission ('98 TJ). Extensive research online indicated this is an ideal lubricant for this transmission, I would have to agree. It improved the shifting a little (most notably when cold) and is safe for the brass synchros. I would highly suggest getting a pump, the fill hole on most transmissions is quite difficult to reach. I got one that fit standard quart bottles, it didn't fit these bottles which was a genuine PITA.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Shift Nice
customer_reviews.text: Seams like I am getting a little smoother shifts on my 1997 Jetta GL compared to the old DIRTY synthetic oil which had 65,000 miles. I wish the bottle was slender to make it easy pour all of the oil into the transmission. I ended up cutting an old 5/8 inch inner diameter garden hose and then heating it up with a heat gun to expand it to the needed .65" diameter to get it over the top. I got every precious golden honey drop out.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my 2004 golf
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my 2004 golf, only gave 4 stars due to price. I noticed a difference in shifting after changing the gear oil, goes between the gears smooth as butter. Worth the $$. My car had 185,000km at the time I change my gear oil. The Red fluid is a sample of the MT-90, the container on the right is what came out of my gear box. So far so good, I've put on 3,000km since the change and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: NewmanGT

customer_reviews.title: Eliminates the grind when shift into reverse
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff for my 2009 Toyota Yaris! Used to grind when shifting into the reverse gear, and had to shift into the first gear to synchronize first. After using MT-90, that grind is GONE. Plus, shifting became really smooth. I thought manual transmission need zero maintenance but I was wrong.I will change it again when having another 50,000 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Jiateng

customer_reviews.title: Buttery smooth shifting
customer_reviews.text: I bought a toyota tacoma and the gearbox was pretty notchy. I couldn't shift into 1st unless I was barely moving, shifts into 2nd were rough and it grinded going into 3rd. I drained the old fluid and added this. Right away it was buttery smooth. No notchiness in any gear. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan C.

customer_reviews.title: Best in it's class!
customer_reviews.text: Best stuff in it's class. Went with Royal Purple as a replacement, but my trans started to make a little more noise and give a little more resistance in shifting. I'm going back to Redline!
customer_reviews.author: f8ldzz

customer_reviews.title: Worked on a ‘94 YJ with 240,000 miles!
customer_reviews.text: 1994 YJ manual trans sticking and hard to get into gear. Drain and filled with regular tranny oil. No help after 1000 miles. Drained 3/4 quart and refilled with Redline and after about 500 miles it is almost smooth. I am going to drain it again and refill with 100% Redline. Expensive but will last 75,000 miles. Pull the trigger and do it yourself. 👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Japanese (Specifically Suzuki) gear boxes -- 94 Sidekick
customer_reviews.text: Not many makers of syncromesh oil that is needed for manual Japanese (Suzuki specifically on mine). Best option for vehicles with brass synchros in the gear box. (It's safe on yellow metal). Smoothed out my shifting tremendously after about 100 miles of city shifting and probably avoided a transmission rebuild on my 25 year old gears.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T McMicken

customer_reviews.title: True GL4 for synchronized transmissions
customer_reviews.text: One of the few true GL4 oils out there. So few, that there is little to compare this to. Does an adequate job.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Dwiggins

customer_reviews.title: Best transmission oil
customer_reviews.text: Best manual transmission oil I've used so far. I replace my tacomas transmission oil every 30k, I used a different brand last interval and this change gave amazing results with this oil. My transmission shifts gears like brand new now, silky smooth. I am a fan now.
customer_reviews.author: viv1d

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE RIGHT STUFF. for Non- World Class T-5.
customer_reviews.text: My freshly rebuilt Non-World Class Borgwarner T-5 was having issues shifting into 3rd gear and at times down shifting as well. I drained out the "recommended" 50wt gear oil and put in Redline MT-90. It seems to have solved the problem completely. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent GL-4 Oil
customer_reviews.text: This is the GL-4 rated stuff that your old MK1-MK3 Volkswagens need, since GL-5 is a *no-no* due to certain additives which may harm brass synchros. I have a MK2 VW with 170k miles on it, and this oil did quiet down some of the wear-related chatter. Shift feel may have improved a bit also. These gear oil ratings are important, so use what is recommended for your car - not necessarily what the latest formulation might be. Its good peace-of-mind to know you have a proper oil in there.
customer_reviews.author: WGee378

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Manual Transmission Fluid
customer_reviews.text: This fluid is as good as the other reviewers say it is. I changed the manual transmission fluid on my 2004 Xterra and it smoothed out the hard shifting quite significantly. I was very impressed with the performance of the fluid. This is a GL-4 Compliant Fluid that is designed for older manual transmission with brass (copper alloy) parts. Apparently, the sulfur additive in unrated GL-5 transmission fluids are harsh on the brass components - unless they are D-130 rated which has undergone testing to ensure compatibility with brass components. Check with your owner's manual Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wise Shopper

customer_reviews.title: No appreciable difference but would still recommend
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other reviews, I haven't noticed any real change in shifting in a vehicle with about 40k miles. That said, though, I would still recommend this product if the desire is to switch to a synthetic. Finding synthetic GL4 transmission oils seems challenging-even within the various automotive chain stores.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton J. Eliason

customer_reviews.title: Good for 97 Miata
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my 170k miles 97 Miata trans. It had Redline in it, from the previous owner. The fluid drained out with 50k miles on it still looked great. Two quarts filled the trans and it still shifts as good as before.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: No more notchiness
customer_reviews.text: Added this to my 94 Toyota Pick-up gear box. Synchros have never felt smoother. Manual shifts feel like a new car. I used to use Valvoline gear oil, but shifting felt a bit notchy. Now that is gone and my drives are more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Flores

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to do
customer_reviews.text: I drive a first generation Toyota Tacoma. I replaced my manual transmission and transfer case fluids with three bottles of RL MT-90. The slight grind going into second was gone. Every other gear felt buttery smooth. I never expected to feel such big improvements with a simple oil change. Very easy to do. You probably should get a pump that fits the 1 quart bottle.
customer_reviews.author: John Jacobs Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the OEM fluid in my 2009 Mazda Rx8's transmission and it worked wonderfully. With this oil you will get the best performance once the transmission warms up, it can be slightly notchy when cold but it really isn't a big deal, it still functions perfectly fine. Would definitely recommend this oil to anyone. Just remember this is ONLY for the transmission, if you want to replace the differential oil you will need the GL-5 version(for my car at least) since that is what it calls for. Consult your vehicle manual or enthusiast forums of your choice to get more info on your own car.
customer_reviews.author: Mac k.

customer_reviews.title: Survives a ton of abuse in the race car
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my race car. I was using conventional gear oil, but it was getting cooked before races were even finished and causing too much transmission wear. This stuff lasts for two races at least and doesn't seem to break down as fully, even when it is done. It also smells better than regular valvoline gear oil, which is also nice. It is pricey, but worth it from what I can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Z.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely oil.
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely transmission gear oil that fits the requirements of my transmission. I have not noticed any positive or negative effects aside of feeling good that I have a good quality oil doing its job in there.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: BEST MANUAL TRANSMISSION FLUID OUT THERE
customer_reviews.text: I am running this in my AX15 and I will say I was very impressed with the product and the transmission shift so smooth after the rebuild and adding this fluid. I will never run anything different in a manual transmission again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2000 Mazda Miata 6-Speed
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my Miata's 6-speed manual transmission. It works great compared to what was in there before, but I still get crunches sometimes shifting from 1-2. I've also only driven about 400 miles with this stuff so far. Hopefully it'll get better with more miles. Also note that this is a GL-4 spec oil, whereas the Miata diff requires GL-5. Don't put this in your Miatas' diff and don't put GL-5 in your trans.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must use in mk4 5spd gearbox
customer_reviews.text: After I converted my mk4 to single mass flywheel I had a lot of trans noise, tryed many different fluids even syncromesh, this(and 10w30 rotella) is the only one that quieted the gearbox, fantastic product
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is great for the Kia Forte
customer_reviews.text: After my 2010 Kia Forte Koup 2.4L 6MT went in for its 45,000 mile maintenance including transmission fluid flush, the OEM fluid the dealership put in the car was absolutely horrible! When it was cold the car would barely shift into second gear. When it was warm gears 2, 4, and 6 would make all sorts of weird noises engaging. I had a local mechanic put this fluid in for me instead. After the first few shifts it was obvious this was an entirely different animal. Shifts now are smooth whether hot or cold. Still great after 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Dr.

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered for classic cars
customer_reviews.text: Early cars with "yellow" metal in gear boxes and differentials - that is brass and bronze, need GL4 oils for lubrication. The newer GL5 oils do not properly protect these yellow metals. Do yourself a favor if you have an older car (my sports car is a 1976 Triumph), and take care of its innards with the proper lubricants. Don't assume that the newer designations for tranny fluid (GL5) is better. For that matter, motor oils, brake fluids, and the like are not necessarily better, especially for older engines.
customer_reviews.author: Connecticut Fan

customer_reviews.title: The best MT fluid out there!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is everything that others have said. The transmission in my 240z had developed a whine. To my shock and horror I discovered the gear box had never been filled with fluid and I had driven the car well over 100 miles already. I filled up the gear box with MT90 and after a few miles all the whine was silenced except for a subtle whine in 5th gear. I am confident once I get some highway driving time in the car that it will go away too. This stuff has been a life saver and it definitely help me dodge a bullet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hadlock

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Made an Instant difference in my 02 Maxima SE with 6sp Manual transmission in ease of shifting and ability to raise RPMs higher. Instant power boost was well. Amazing product and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Charles V.

customer_reviews.title: The best choice for you classic VW Transaxle
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gear oil for Classic Volkswagen Type 1 & 2 transaxles. It provides the requires GL-4 rating needed while adding the benefit of quieter operation and buttery smooth gear engagement in any temperature. Be aware the synthetic nature of this gear oil will allow more oil seepage than regular non-synthetic, but it is nothing to be alarmed about. Gear oil loss over the years is negligible.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Jon

customer_reviews.title: Red Line means go
customer_reviews.text: Have a 98 Jeep wrangler, manual 5 speed. Had the transmission rebuilt and was still having trouble getting it into second gear when it was cold. Jeep manual transmissions are notorious for this. Did some research on lubrication or additives that have had success in alleviating this problem. Red Line did the trick. It goes into second gear without warming it up at all, and it now shifts so much smoother in every other gear. I would recommend this to anybody that has a manual transmission whether having shifting issues or not.
customer_reviews.author: DGH

customer_reviews.title: Needed GL4 grease for an old car.
customer_reviews.text: I needed GL4 grease for an old Corvair instead of the newer GL5 that was about all I could find locally. The GL5 has stuff in it that will hurt a transmission or rear end with brass parts in them. The GL4 doesn't hurt brass. So I ordered it on line even if I hadn't ever heard of Red Line products. I would guess Red Line grease will work fine for a car I don't expect to drive over a couple of thousand miles a year. Would I put it in my new car. No way I would want a major brand GL5 for a new car.
customer_reviews.author: Charles F. Richerson

customer_reviews.title: Magic in a bottle
customer_reviews.text: 04 VW TDI. Had a 3rd gear scratch frequently. Only on upshift. Replaced fluid and after about 5,000 miles, haven't had a 3rd gear scratch again. I am a believer. Give it time. It's not instant. It won't fix all your synchro problems, but it definitely fixed mine. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% satisfied but happy
customer_reviews.text: I used it on my Mazda, and I am sure Red Line is better than Mazda factory filled oil. Below are my personal rating for comparing Red Line Oil and Factory Oil. Cold Shifting: Red Line 8 out of 10, Factory Oil 6 out of 10 When gear box reaches working temperature: Red Line 9.5 out of 10, Factory Oil 7.5 out of 10 When driving in a stop and go condition for more than two hours: Red Line Oil 8.5 out of 10, Factory Oil 7 out of 10 Overall: Red Line 9 out of 10, Factory Oil 7 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2015 Chevy Cruze eco
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping great fluid. Fixed the 1st to 2nd gear bump in gear shift for 2015 Chevy Cruze eco manual. GM only puts in 1.9 quarts and use a much thinner MT fluid. 2.4 quarts and this 75-90 does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: carl sanders

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work very well in Mazdaspeed3 when cold
customer_reviews.text: Had Redline MT90 transmission fluid in my 2008 Mazdaspeed3 for about 1200 miles. Although Redline was recommended on some online forums, it did not work well for me when shifting from 1st to 2nd gear until the car was warmed up. If the temperature where you live is always above 50 degrees Redline would probably be fine in this vehicle. Anyway, I replace the Redline fluid with Ford XT-M5-QS fluid and that has solved my problem. All shifts feel buttery smooth and the car is a pleasure to drive again.
customer_reviews.author: W. Richter

customer_reviews.title: Came as described
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working great. I put it in my 2000 Lotus Esprit and shifting is much smoother. Will be using again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: I used this in the 5-speed manual transmission in my Toyota Tacoma, replacing the factory fill when it had 15k miles on it. In the dead of winter, when the truck first starts out, it is a bit notchy. But it very quickly becomes as smooth as melted butter. Highly recommend the Redline products. As others have said, Toyotas spec either GL-4 or GL-5. The GL-4 is supposedly smoother on the synchronizers in the transmission.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Red Line MT-90...excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is the ONLY fluid to use in your in your manual transmission. Shifts are smooth, not like the 85 weight syrup they put in at the dealer!! Only product I'll ever use in my 08 Mazda MX-5, 6-speed. Cleared up my shifting problems after the Mazda dealer did their $90 trans fluid change with 85 weight GL-5 oil !!. If your manual transmission is hard to shift, replace fluid with this and notice the BIG difference.
customer_reviews.author: gmw

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Wow great fluid. Changed the clutch in my sons car and figured why not change the fluid. Car shifts smoother. Very much recommend
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This is great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I swear this gear oil has made my transmission shift smoother than whatever the dealership used in the past. Plus, the GL-4 spec won't ruin your brass synchros! This is great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Mav

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Find GL4 Fluid
customer_reviews.text: Changed the axle seals and cv boots on my MR2 Spyder and I needed a oil that was GL4. The MT-90 fluid fit the bill. It pumped well with a cheap pump from harbor freight. The shifts seem to be less notchy and smoother when cold. Thank you redline.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P.

customer_reviews.title: Use in the manual transmission of a 2007 Yaris (2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Use in the manual transmission of a 2007 Yaris (2 qt. needed). I don't know if the old trans oil was ever changed, but the Red Line has substantially smoothed shifting. It does take about 10-20 miles of driving before you really notice the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gearbox lube!!
customer_reviews.text: Using this in an 02 RAV4 5 speed gearbox.... This stuff is amazing, it shifts better than it did with the factory lube. I'd highly recommend this if it meets the specifications for your transmission.
customer_reviews.author: Go Gators

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic oil. A little pricey but worth it. Cut the gear noise on my transfer case in half. Tranny shifts smoother than ever. Hard to find a synthetic GL4 lube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't find anything wrong here!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because of all the great reviews I had read on-line. Price was right and shipping was expeditious. I have no complaints using it in my '99 Toyota Corolla with 225,000 miles! Everything is running great. Unfortunately I can't give a comparison reference as I don't know what was in my trans case previously. I had had a new clutch put in a few years ago but don't know what the mechanic used. I had to replace a cv axle so i went ahead and replaced the fluid with the MT-90. I will purchase this again and again. Thanks, Amazon and RED LINE!!!
customer_reviews.author: diggywiggy

customer_reviews.title: great lube!
customer_reviews.text: replaced my transmission fluid for my 96 240sx. originally had valvoline instant oil change guys do it for me with valvoline fluids, but they put in valvoline GL5 fluid even though they said it was going to be GL4! i could instantly tell that the fluid was too thick. getting it in gear was extremely difficult, made worse with cold weather. i would never go back to vavoline. and since GL5 corrodes components in the tranny, i needed to get it out as quickly as possible, and therefore went with the redline MT90W. it's been 6 months, and the tranny feels great!
customer_reviews.author: lkim

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Day and night improvement in my 05 x runner immediately noticeable difference in smoothness of shift.
customer_reviews.author: jose a

customer_reviews.title: Great for my old Beemer's transmission!
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my 1991 BMW R100 Motorcycle's transmission. From the first click into 1st gear when cold I could tell this was going to be what the 19 year old tranny needed. It has had regular changes of tranny fluid with OTC gear lubes, which work OK when real new, but soon become clunky when hot. The synthetic Redline pours readily and really has smoothed out the downshift when running hard, and when coming to a stop, where old Beemer's are really clunky when hot. I'm sold. UPDATE: 11-12-2013 3 years later -- Like the way the fluid worked, so I am buying and using it again.
customer_reviews.author: Moodies forever

customer_reviews.title: UUC magic mix!
customer_reviews.text: Mixed this 50/50 Redline 75w140ns in my 95M3 after installing the UUC stage 2 Lightweight flywheel and M5 clutch package. With 200,000 miles on the odometer Im very impressed with this setup. A little crunch when cold going into 2nd and 3rd but thats due to worn syncros. No flywheel chatter. Weve only hit 95 degrees so far this spring so if it continues wit no chatter till fall I'll run a little thinner mixture to help out those aging syncros in the cooler temps.
customer_reviews.author: Honesty

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE.
customer_reviews.text: Restored smooth function to a transmission and shifter that had been neglected and become difficult to get into gear. Very happy with it. Not as happy with the price - but WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.author: J just J

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommende for manual transmissions
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few gear oils that will not harm yellow metal, (brass), synchro's.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Driver

customer_reviews.title: Shifting is noticeably smoother now
customer_reviews.text: Seems so far like a great product. I have noticed gear shifting to be easier than before. and was easy to pump into transmission. Be sure to buy one of the pump sprayers for this. (even if does not fit the lid of the container perfectly ..should be no problem getting the gear oil to pump easily into transmission)
customer_reviews.author: horoscopy

customer_reviews.title: Car shifts more smoothly now
customer_reviews.text: Made a noticeable difference in the smoothness of each of my shifts. Used this on a 2010 Toyota Corolla 5 speed MT, which was beginning to feel very "notchy" and sluggish between shifts. Also, I noticed a third-gear grind as well, likely due to a faulty synchronizer; this fluid didn't really solve that issue, so I'm just double-clutching second-third now...not a big deal. Overall I would recommend this transmission fluid to anyone with a compatible vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Zahir

customer_reviews.title: recommended by hot rod aficionados
customer_reviews.text: I topped off the tranny fluid on my 1966 GTO with a Borg Warner Super T-10 transmission
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Fagan

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This product will work wonders. The price shouldnt be as much. I wonder what the profit margins are. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Weston

customer_reviews.title: Buy the gallon size !
customer_reviews.text: Used on borg warner super t10 transmission and it improved shifting issue with 3rd gear. Drained oil after driving twice and replaced oil again. Transmission is working great. Minimal cost compared to rebuilding my transmission
customer_reviews.author: Linda Haberman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff.
customer_reviews.text: My '05 Mazda 6i with manual went about 60k miles on the factory trans fluid, and was starting to grind gears, not catch synchros, and generally be everything a manual trans doesn't want to be. Unfortunately, synthetic 75W90 gear oil that is GL4 is hard to find (pretty much everything in stores is GL5). I refilled with MT90 and in a few hundred miles she was back to normal, with no more missed shifts because the synchros weren't catching. If your trans calls for a GL4 75W90 gear oil, you can't go wrong here.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Ordered Twice
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my manual shift Nissan D21 Hardbody. These transmissions (Nissan, Honda, and Toyota) contain what are called Yellow Metals (brass synchronizers and bearings), so they can NOT take newer GL-5 or those parts can be worn away within 10k miles. When I replaced my older, non-synthetic oil with this newer synthetic oil, the transmission shifts better and smoother, goes into gears better, etc. I liked this stuff so much, I ordered it again for another vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: jp2code

customer_reviews.title: Good and oily
customer_reviews.text: It's oil... How do I know if it's any better than cheaper oils. It was recommended for my RX8 and so I bought it. I don't notice any difference good or bad
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to replace GL-4 gear oil
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace my factory oil in a 2003 Toyota Corolla. It made the 5-speed shifting amazingly smooth and reduced crunching into 3rd gear. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: The Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Put in my 92 Jeep Wrangler YJ (AX5 Transmisison). ...
customer_reviews.text: Put in my 92 Jeep Wrangler YJ (AX5 Transmisison). Shifts are smoother than they ever have been. I have a problem now with 4th gear popping out to neutral when i slow down abruptly. No idea if its too smooth in the transmission now or if its something else, but it never did that before.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great in my 03 Celica GTS!!
customer_reviews.text: My Celica GTS transmission requires 3 bottles and the price is good! After researching many times, I decided to go with this. I recently bought my Celica and decided to change the oil for the transmission. The old oil was bad, bad enough to smell it a few times while driving, which isn't a good thing. So I changed it and noticed a big difference! My car now shifts smoothly with this new oil. I plan on using this for rest of my Celica's life and change the oil every 15,000 miles. This gear oil is a must get!!
customer_reviews.author: CNL

customer_reviews.title: I used this in my 1987 BMW 325is (E30) and ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my 1987 BMW 325is (E30) and it makes shifts much smoother. My trans is worn out and makes bretty loud bearing whine from 1st - 3rd gears, and this minimizes that, minimizes noises when shifting and allows it to go into gear easier. EXCEPT when it is cold out. Below 40 or so and I have a really hard time getting it into first or second, but that is not the fault of the oil.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Bruch

customer_reviews.title: Its highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Used it based on suggestions and recommendations from many ppl online. So far its ok
customer_reviews.author: Muhammad

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.text: I had installed Mobil-1 75w90 GL-5 synthetic gear oil in my Toyota Tacoma's transmission and differential with some friction modifier in the diff. Worked fine in the diff but started have an issue with 5th gear clashing on the upshift, changed to the Redline GL-4 75w90 synthetic and issue was gone within a few miles. This oil is made specifically for manual transmissions. I won't use anything else from now on.
customer_reviews.author: RKnorr

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff. I mixed two quart D4 with one ...
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff. I mixed two quart D4 with one quart MT-90 for my 06 Mustang GT manual transmission. It worked well when it was still warm. The transmission was significantly quieter that it was before. Then it was colder in the winter and I can feel the car lost a bit 5-10 hp. Its surely too thick for T-3650 in the winter. I decided to change it all to D4 see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: Yanping Shen

customer_reviews.title: Great gear oil
customer_reviews.text: I've used quite a few different gear oils in my car over the years but am happy I finally settled on this redline. I was having major problems with my MT before swapping to this even to the point of suspecting bad synchros or a bad clutch but alas it is now like driving a new car all over again. The gears are super easy to shift into and out of now and as a bonus my transmission seems a bit quieter overall. I highly recommend this to anyone, it is well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: N. Walter

customer_reviews.title: Red Line is a very high quality gear oil. ...
customer_reviews.text: Red Line is a very high quality gear oil. I used it in my Toyota Tacoma 4x4 4 cyl. With a whopping 159 hp on tap, I needed all the power I could get and Red Line oil in the drive lines (front and rear diffs - see proper gear oil/Trans Case/Transmission) and Mobil 1 5w20 went a long way toward reducing friction. Fuel economy increased by about 1-2 MPG.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Fluid For Triumph TR-6
customer_reviews.text: I needed to change the tranny and differential fluid on my Triumph TR-6. Did some research and heard good things about Red Line, so I ordered the MT-90 75W-90 GL-4 fluid. This car had an occassional grind downshifting to 3rd gear. After changing to the Red Line, the grinding stopped and the tranny shifts a lot smoother. My only negative is that I now have a slight leak from the rear seal of the tranny.
customer_reviews.author: aestrada19

customer_reviews.title: Redline rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a longtime Redline lubricants fan because of their high quality and specific properties of the products themselves. In this case, (MT-90) the key property is to provide enough friction between gearshifts to allow the synchronizers to slow down and provide smooth gearshifts. This is not an easy task to perform while still lubricating and being slippery enough to provide a consistent oil film, lubricity, resistance to thermal breakdown and long fluid life. If you have an older transmission that's getting more difficult to shift, Redline MT-90 can improve it and extend the time before a rebuild is necessary.
customer_reviews.author: J. Buck

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this oil.
customer_reviews.text: One of the better gear oils on the market. Speaking from strictly the view of a sports car driver that sees many track days, these oils withstand some very harsh conditions. (pasted from my review of the 75W90 gear oil, remember they are different, one for transmission and the other for differentials)
customer_reviews.author: Brais Whirl

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: Been using redline for years on my Nissan’s can’t go wrong. Always tends to make shifting way smoother
customer_reviews.author: Pathum

customer_reviews.title: Did the job well
customer_reviews.text: I have an rsx type s 2004 and after switching out the tranny fluid with this my third gear stopped popping out much like how all Honda’s around that generation do.
customer_reviews.author: Arnel

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Product!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to switch from the Lucas 75w-90 to this and definitely saw a great improvement in shift smoothness. I used this on my 2000 Toyota Celica GT. Although one of the bottles leaked while being shipped I think the quality of the product is amazing. I would just recommend to have better handling of the product while in transit.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Beltran

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: This is great stuff. I used it out of desperation in a 4-speed '82 VW Rabbit diesel. Shifting was very rough before. I even bought a used transmission thinking I would have to swap it out. Within 100 miles or so of changing the fluid, it smoothed right out. I ended up deciding I wouldn't need a trans swap after all.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Z

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long time Red Line user and will continue to be. Worked great in my 82 Supra, 92 300zx, and now my 2005 Tacoma Xrunner. Whether it's your differential or transmission, you'll be glad you bought it. Make sure to get the correct weight of oil and posi-trac additive for your posi-trac differentials if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Lingenfelter

product_meta.title: Red Line (50304) MT-90 75W-90 GL-4 Manual Transmission and Transaxle Lubricant - 1 Quart
product_meta.description: Size:Pack of 1Manual transmission gear lube 75W90 GL-4 that offers quicker shifts, improved coefficient of friction, and better gear protection. Also offers better cold shifting and works with high and low mileage vehicles.
feature_bullets: Less slippery low sulfur formula compatible with brass synchronizers
Stable at high temperatures in performance applications
Also available as lighter viscosity like MTL and MT-85
Satisfies gear oil viscosity requirements of 75W; 80W; SAE 40 10W40 and 15W40 motor oil
Popular in VW Audi; Nissan; Toyota and Mazda
